page.title: 12HOUSING IN EASTLEIGH.
page.content: In Eastleigh Town Centre there are mainly blocks of old terraced houses which were built about 80 years ago in the railway "boom".As a result of the Second World War some large council estates were built to house homeless people c 1950.In 1960-1970 the local council had the idea of demolishing terraced houses and replacing them with blocks of flats,which still exist.The idea however proved too costly and was stopped. General improvement grants enabled house owners to modernise their old terraced houses. In the early 70's large private estates were built.Flats are now being built to house one parent families and single people.Eastleigh at the moment is a rapidly developing area.
